message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.IR, cs.NE 

This paper is likely to belong to the arXiv CS sub-category of cs.CL (Computation and Language) as it deals with natural language processing tasks such as sentiment analysis and information extraction. The use of recursive neural networks and conditional random fields also suggests that it could belong to the sub-category of cs.LG (Machine Learning). Additionally, the incorporation of hand-crafted features could place it in the sub-category of cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). The task of aspect-based sentiment analysis also involves information retrieval and search, which could make it relevant to the sub-category of cs.IR (Information Retrieval). Finally, the use of neural networks and machine learning techniques could also make it relevant to the sub-category of cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing).
